channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Warhammer maker gives its ‘unique, and often quirky’ staff $8,600 each
item.description: Games Workshop is paying $22.9 million to its workers as reward for a double-digit profit boost last year.

item.title: 'Marathon not a sprint': Apple's AI push faces big challenges in China
item.description: Apple Intelligence is Apple's big play that aims to bring artificial intelligence across its devices but there was little talk on how it will bring this to China.

item.title: Barclays says U.S. immigration was far more than CBO estimated last year
Chinese carmakers are losing their appetite for Europe after the EU imposed tariffs on their EVs
item.description: Over 80% of Chinese vehicle firms are less confident about investing in Europe in the near-term, reports a China Chamber of Commerce to the EU survey.

item.title: Thursday's analyst calls: Nvidia to rally more than 20%, Meta Platforms gets a price target hike
item.description: A chipmaking giant and Instagram's parent company were among the stocks being talked about by analysts on Thursday.

item.title: Dollar rallies against Swiss franc after SNB rate cut
Boeing 737 Max crash victims' families ask the Justice Department to fine the planemaker $25 billion
item.description: That amount is “legally justified and clearly appropriate,” Paul Cassell, an attorney who represents 15 victims’ families, said in a letter sent to the DOJ on Wednesday.

item.title: Hezbollah leader warns Israel of war with 'no red lines,' threatens Cyprus
item.description: Hezbollah vowed a fight with "no red lines" if full-our war erupts between Lebanon and Israel, warning neighboring Cyprus against getting mired in the conflict.

item.title: German slump drags European Union's EV sales 12% lower in May
Thomson Reuters CEO: AI guardrails remain unclear—but all companies can begin by pledging to protect their customers’ data privacy
item.description: 'We won’t allow a customer’s data to be used to train a third-party LLM,' writes Thomson Reuters CEO Steve Hasker.

item.title: The best-funded generative AI startups in Europe have something in common: Big Tech experience
item.description: Most of the top-funded generative AI companies in Europe were founded by entrepreneurs with experience at U.S. technology giants, according to Accel.

item.title: U.K. inflation rate is back at the Bank of England’s target
Tropical Storm Alberto—the first named one of the season—leaves 3 dead
item.description: Late Wednesday, Alberto was located about 135 miles east of Tampico, Mexico, and about 320 miles south-southeast of Brownsville, Texas.

item.title: UK PM Sunak could cease to be a lawmaker in landslide election defeat, new poll shows
item.description: The main opposition left-of-center Labour Party is on course to win a whopping 516 seats at the July 4 election, according to a shock new poll.

item.title: The 4-day workweek is closer than you think: ‘It's better for humans in general’
